perturbation.original_text: (a) JANA agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the earliest of (i) the date that is thirty (30) calendar days prior to any applicable deadline by which a shareholder must give notice to the Company of its intention to nominate a director for election at or bring other business before the 2015 Annual Meeting under the Company's By足Laws and (ii) any material breach of this Agreement by the Company (provided that the Company shall have three (3) business days following written notice from JANA of material breach to remedy such material breach if capable of remedy) (such period, the "Cooperation Period"), neither it nor any of its Affiliates or Associates will in any manner, directly or indirectly, make, or cause to be made, or in any way encourage any other person to make or cause to be made, any statement or announcement that relates to and constitutes an ad hominem attack on, or relates to and otherwise disparages, the Company, any of its officers or directors or any person who has served as an officer or director of the Company, including: (i) in any document or report filed with or furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") or any other governmental agency, (ii) in any press release or other publicly available format or (iii) to any journalist or member of the media (including without limitation, in a television, radio, newspaper or magazine interview), or otherwise; provided, that if the Company makes any material announcement prior to the March Board Meeting, JANA will be permitted to make objective statements that solely reflect JANA's view, as a shareholder, with respect to such announcement.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) JANA agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the earliest of (i) the date that is fifteen (15) calendar days prior to any applicable deadline by which a shareholder must give notice to the Company of its intention to nominate a director for election at or bring other business before the 2015 Annual Meeting under the Company's By足Laws and (ii) any material breach of this Agreement by the Company (provided that the Company shall have one (1) business day following written notice from JANA of material breach to remedy such material breach if capable of remedy) (such period, the "Cooperation Period"), neither it nor any of its Affiliates or Associates will in any manner, directly or indirectly, make, or cause to be made, or in any way encourage any other person to make or cause to be made, any statement or announcement that relates to and constitutes an ad hominem attack on, or relates to and otherwise disparages, the Company, any of its officers or directors or any person who has served as an officer or director of the Company, including: (i) in any document or report filed with or furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") or any other governmental agency, (ii) in any press release or other publicly available format or (iii) to any journalist or member of the media (including without limitation, in a television, radio, newspaper or magazine interview), or otherwise; provided, that if the Company makes any material announcement prior to the March Board Meeting, JANA will be permitted to make objective statements that solely reflect JANA's view, as a shareholder, with respect to such announcement.
perturbation.explanation: Shortening the notice period to 15 days before the deadline for nominating directors may violate state corporate laws or SEC regulations that require a longer period for shareholders to exercise their rights. Similarly, providing only one business day for the Company to remedy a material breach is unreasonable and may be deemed insufficient under Delaware law, where companies are typically afforded a reasonable cure period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law, SEC Regulations regarding shareholder rights

perturbation.original_text: (b) The Company agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the earliest of (i) the date that is thirty (30) calendar days prior to any applicable deadline by which a shareholder must give notice to the Company of its intention to nominate a director for election at or bring other business before the 2015 Annual Meeting under the Company's By足Laws and (ii) any material breach of this Agreement by JANA (provided that JANA shall have three (3) business days following written notice from the Company of material breach to remedy such material breach if capable of remedy), neither it nor any of its Affiliates or Associates will in any manner, directly or indirectly make, or cause to be made, or in any way encourage any other person to make or cause to be made, any statement or announcement that relates to and constitutes an ad hominem attack on, or relates to and otherwise disparages, JANA, any of its members, officers or directors or any person who has served as a member, officer or director of JANA, including: (i) in any document or report filed with or furnished to the SEC or any other governmental agency, (ii) in any press release or other publicly available format or (iii) to any journalist or member of the media (including without limitation, in a television, radio, newspaper or magazine interview), or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) The Company agrees that, from the date of this Agreement until the earliest of (i) the date that is forty-five (45) calendar days prior to any applicable deadline by which a shareholder must give notice to the Company of its intention to nominate a director for election at or bring other business before the 2015 Annual Meeting under the Company's By足Laws and (ii) any material breach of this Agreement by JANA (provided that JANA shall have one (1) business day following written notice from the Company of material breach to remedy such material breach if capable of remedy), neither it nor any of its Affiliates or Associates will in any manner, directly or indirectly make, or cause to be made, or in any way encourage any other person to make or cause to be made, any statement or announcement that relates to and constitutes an ad hominem attack on, or relates to and otherwise disparages, JANA, any of its members, officers or directors or any person who has served as a member, officer or director of JANA, including: (i) in any document or report filed with or furnished to the SEC or any other governmental agency, (ii) in any press release or other publicly available format or (iii) to any journalist or member of the media (including without limitation, in a television, radio, newspaper or magazine interview), or otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: Extending the notice period to 45 days prior to the deadline for nominating directors may violate state corporate laws or SEC regulations that affect shareholder rights, creating a legal contradiction. Reducing the breach remedy timeframe to one business day may be viewed as an unreasonable cure period, conflicting with standard legal expectations for contract disputes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Delaware General Corporation Law, SEC Regulations regarding shareholder rights, Contract Law

perturbation.original_text: (b) Notwithstanding any other Section in this Agreement and without limiting any other remedies the Company may have in law or equity, in the event that JANA (or any Affiliate or Associate of JANA) fails to perform or otherwise fulfill its obligations set forth in Section 7 in any material respect, and shall not have remedied such failure or non-fulfillment if capable of being remedied or fulfilled within three (3) business days following written notice from the Company of such failure or non-fulfillment, the Company shall not be required to perform or fulfill its obligations set forth in Sections 3, 4, 5 or 7 and the JANA Nominees shall each promptly tender their resignation as a member of the Board effective immediately upon its acceptance by the Company. As a condition to nomination and/or appointment to the Board pursuant to this Agreement, each JANA Nominee shall have executed an irrevocable letter agreement with the Company in which each such JANA Nominee shall agree to resign if required in accordance with the immediately preceding sentence.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Notwithstanding any other Section in this Agreement and without limiting any other remedies the Company may have in law or equity, in the event that JANA (or any Affiliate or Associate of JANA) fails to perform or otherwise fulfill its obligations set forth in Section 7 in any material respect, and shall not have remedied such failure or non-fulfillment if capable of being remedied or fulfilled within one (1) business day following written notice from the Company of such failure or non-fulfillment, the Company shall not be required to perform or fulfill its obligations set forth in Sections 3, 4, 5 or 7 and the JANA Nominees shall each promptly tender their resignation as a member of the Board effective immediately upon its acceptance by the Company. As a condition to nomination and/or appointment to the Board pursuant to this Agreement, each JANA Nominee shall have executed an irrevocable letter agreement with the Company in which each such JANA Nominee shall agree to resign if required in accordance with the immediately preceding sentence.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time JANA has to remedy a failure to fulfill its obligations to one business day may be deemed unreasonable under contract law principles, especially under Delaware law. Courts typically require a reasonable cure period, and one day may not be sufficient to address complex breaches, potentially violating the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing, Delaware Law regarding reasonable cure periods
